summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 regarding scheduling a 'Law Enforcement Brown Bag' presentation for SDNY summer interns. The emails mention that participants have been traveling for the Epstein case and confirm logistical details for the event.

persons.name: Hellman, Matthew
persons.context: Appears as the primary organizer of the 'SDNY Summer Interns - Law Enforcement Brown Bag' event, sending logistical emails to participants.

events.title: SDNY Law Enforcement Brown Bag Presentation
events.description: A scheduled presentation for SDNY summer interns where law enforcement officials were to discuss their career paths and work, including work related to the Epstein case.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
2nd Fl. Library (presumably at One St. Andrew's Plaza)
keyFacts: The email chain is dated July 2019, indicating ongoing work related to the Epstein case by SDNY personnel at that time.
A participant mentions 'we've been traveling a lot for that Epstein case,' suggesting active investigation or case-related travel.
The event was a 'Law Enforcement Brown Bag' for SDNY summer interns, intended to feature officials discussing their work.
The correspondence shows internal scheduling and coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The primary location mentioned is the SDNY office at One St. Andrew's Plaza in New York City.
